channel.title: Posts on Tolar Town
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Tolar Town

item.title: 2 museums & some food
item.description: My first full day in Seoul! I had a good breakfast at Bimbam Cafe near the hotel, then walked down to the War Memorial of Korea, which encompassed lots of history of Korea, with an emphasis on the Korean War. I had a yummy sandwich at Casablanca in Itaewon, then met up with Tiffany & fam to see the Gyeongbokgung Palace and the Arario museum. We had a dope Korean dinner of seafood & veggie pancake, a spicy salad with chestnut jelly, and a creamy noodle soup, along with makgeolli, a Korean rice wine that was yum.

item.title: Seoul!
item.description: After a long flight from Melbourne with a middle-of-the-night layover in Singapore, I made it to Seoul! I took the KAL (Korean Airlines) Limousine Bus from Seoul’s Incheon airport to the Grand Hyatt hotel. The bus was pretty nice, as it does a loop from the airport to major hotels in Seoul, so it’s a easy, inexpensive way to efficiently get to the destination. I was pretty wiped out when I checked in, but I managed to walk down to Full Moon where I had a beef bulgogi meal, complete with various Korean style sides.

item.title: So long, Australia
item.description: For the past four weeks, I’ve been in Australia, mostly staying in Melbourne, but also Torquay and Hobart (Tasmania). It’s been amazing! I’ve been blown away by how nice of a city is, let alone the fantastic food, coffee, & drinks available nearly everywhere. Here are a few terms I’ve learned along the way… Australian English US English Footy Australia-rules football Toasties toasted sandwich Jaffle also a toasted sandwich Take away take out Booking reservation Return round trip Brekkie breakfast burger literally anything in a bun (e.

item.title: Johnston street festival
item.description: Just a few blocks from where I’m staying, I happened upon a multi-block street festival that had two stages of various music & dancing, and in between a menagerie of food options. I ended up getting some chicken ‘wanton’ tacos, which were pretty tasty.

item.title: Mate Fest
item.description: Today, Taylor & I went to Mate Fest, an international beer fest hosted by Moon Dog Brewery in Melbourne. Our friend Erik from Magpie in Seoul gave a masterclass, which was pretty fun! Breakfast at Grace Cafe: Chilli Scrambled Eggs, with Lao gan ma chilli, pickled shiitake, enoki and szechuan crunch on toast Taylor & me Magpie’s Erik giving a masterclass Moon dog had a dope analog style version of Pong

item.title: A random day
item.description: A mostly random sort of day with Erik and Taylor. We ate and drank our way around Melbourne. Soft shelled crab ‘burger’, from Proud Mary’s. (basically, they seem to call anything on a bun a ‘burger’) Tempura green beans, from Byrdi. Grau Projekt: an art opening that a bartender told me about, which had about 8 pieces on the wall, literal tons of salt on the floor, and maybe 9 people there.

item.title: Low key day
item.description: I mostly had a low-key day before meeting up with Rob and Erik for a fantastic dinner at Chin Chin, then Erik & I went to Mr West for some beer. Earlier in the day, I stopped by my artwork to discover only half of it had been painted over in its first 24 hours of life, which I was pretty happy about! (I mostly expected it to be completely gone by then.

item.title: Street art
item.description: I went on a walking tour of street art in Melbourne that I found on Airbnb. Lukas took me and another guest around to see some cool street art, pointed out various different styles, and put it all into context and the culture around the street art scene here. BUT, the highlight is that we got to make our own street art. It was awesome! I was super nervous to start, but it came out way better than I had hoped.

item.title: PENGUINS!!!!
item.description: This afternoon and evening, I went to St Kilda Pier in the southern part of Melbourne. Every day at sunset, a colony of penguins swims back to the rocks to sleep. You can catch a couple of them inside the rocks during the day, but the real treat is right at sunset, when they swim up to the shore and waddle up to the rocks. PENGUINS!!! St Kilda Pier

item.title: The Melbourne Zoo
item.description: After a lot of colder, rainy days, it was gorgeous in Melbourne today. I walked a couple of miles over to the zoo, where I saw some dope animals. Elephant Giraffe Wild dogs Lion

item.title: South Melbourne Market & Supernormal
item.description: I met up with Taylor, Maki, Sheena, & Brenda at the South Melbourne Market, where we had coffee and pastries, walked around, did some shopping, and then had a paella lunch at Simply Spanish in the market. We stopped by their house for a bit before Taylor & I went to dinner at Supernormal, which turned out to be my best meal in Melbourne (so far at least!). We started with cocktails and the raw Kingfish with mandarin dashi, arame.

item.title: Dinner at Charcoal Lane
item.description: I stopped by Charcoal Lane tonight for dinner, which not only has delicious food and drink, but is also a “social enterprise restaurant that provides guidance and opportunity to young Aboriginal people who are in need of a fresh start in life.” So you can feel good about where your money’s going while enjoying some kangaroo! I started with a negroni: Native pepperberry infused gin, Antica Formula, Campari. I couldn’t quite detect any significant pepperberry flavor, but it was still delicious.

item.title: A day in Torquay and a drive to see some animals
item.description: I spent the morning in Torquay with Rob. We had breakfast at Ginger Monkey, where I had a scrumptious mushroom and poached eggs on toast, and we took a tour of the Surf Museum. He went home to work, and I drove down to Anglesea to a golf club where kangaroos live. I then drove further down the Great Ocean Road, which was quite gorgeous. If it wasn’t raining, I would have stopped to take some photos.

item.title: Melbourne to Torquay
item.description: I rented (or “hired”) a car via Oyo, which is like Zipcar, but is somehow related to Toyota (get it, “Toyota”), and I drove down to Torquay, a beautiful town on the beach about a 90 minute drive from Melbourne. I saw some lovely beaches, some gorgeous rolling hills, had some good food, and experienced some mediocre fast food. Plus I got to hang out with Rob and his family!

item.title: A visit to the Royal Botanic Gardens
item.description: Taylor, Sheena, & I took a walk around the Royal Botanic Gardens in Victoria, which was gorgeous. We had a coffee at the tea room in the middle of the gardens, and later had a delightful lunch a short walk away at Denis the Menace (lol). Taylor & Sheena Gardens Sheena & Taylor Spaghetti

item.title: A visit to the Victorian Parliament
item.description: I had a lovely breakfast at Rustica in Fitzroy, followed by a late morning espresso at Aunty Peg’s. I walked around a bit in Fitzroy and had a mid-afternoon visit to the Victorian House of Parliament, which was pretty neat. I got to see where Queen Elizabeth sat to open Parliament back in 1954! I had a delicious dinner of dumplings & chicken at Hutong Dumpling House and a couple of cocktails at Bar Americano and Over Board, which were dope.

item.title: A trip to Hawthorne
item.description: I traveled to Hawthorne via a tram and a train to Taylor’s house to visit him, Maki, their child Sheena, and Taylor’s mom Brenda. It’s been great to catch up, and I loved meeting the baby! Taylor & Sheena Sheena & I Hawthorne views Breakfast in Fitzroy

item.title: A day out shopping
item.description: It was a slow morning due to quite a bit of ongoing rain outside. I did make it out in the morning all the way across the street to the Saturday market to buy a loaf of sourdough and a coffee (which I then had with some eggs I made at home). I finally left the house for a bit this afternoon to get some lunch and check out some shops that were on my list.

item.title: The last few days: Tasmania!
item.description: I spent the last few days in Tasmania, but I left my laptop behind, so I’ve just posted photos from the trip. Here are the posts I’ve just posted: Breakfast before flying to Hobart Hobart is pretty dope Pennicott seafood seduction cruise A day at MONA Evening in Hobart Last day in Hobart A walk through Fitzroy A lazy day Come to Tasmania, we mean you!

item.title: A lazy day in Fitzroy
item.description: I was wiped out from traveling back from Tasmania and doing the walking tour last night, so I laid low around the neighborhood, did some laundry, and ordered in for dinner. (And got this blog updated!) Espresso, Grace Café Mushrooms on toast, Grace Café Brunswick Street building Fried chicken sandwich, Industry Beans

item.title: A walk through Fitzroy
item.description: For my birthday, Molly gave me a gift of a “Drinking History Tour” through Fitzroy, where I’ve been staying in Melbourne. On the evening of Halloween, I walked down to St. Patrick’s Cathedral to meet up with the tour. We learned some history & drank some drinks! It was pretty fun! Fitzroy Street Library A house A Tribe Called Quest Judy Jetson St. Patrick’s Cathedral

item.title: Last day in Hobart
item.description: I walked around Hobart a bit before heading back to Melbourne. Halloween isn’t huge in Australia, but I did see a few costumes … maybe? Baked eggs Port Halloween? Wildlife I thought I wouldn’t get my chance, but the Hobart airport came through, and I had a scallop pie for lunch!

item.title: Evening in Hobart
item.description: I met up with Joel, met his adorable St. Bernard named Victoria, then we got some dinner and some whisky to finish off the night. Victoria Gnocchi with funghi sauce Pizza Port at sunset Glass House bathroom selfie

item.title: A day at MONA
item.description: I spent a day at the Museum of Old and New Art, known as “MONA”. It was an incredible experience, starting with a delightful ferry ride from Hobart up to the museum. Spoilers below! If you want to see these works without knowledge of them, please skip this post. James Turrell’s “Unseen Seen + Weight of Darkness” broke my head. His work continues to blow me away since I first saw him at the Los Angeles Contemporary Museum of Art (LACMA).

item.title: Pennicott seafood seduction cruise
item.description: Per Harper’s recommendation, I went on the Pennicott Seafood Seduction tour today, where our fearless guides Sam & Hugh took us on a cruise through the waters of Hobart, Tasmania. Not only were they our guides, they were also our captains, fishermen, chefs, and entertainers – their constant prattle & wit back and forth kept the cruise light-hearted and fun. The day was amazing, the food top-notch, and the sights were something to behold.

item.title: Hobart is pretty dope
item.description: I spent a few days in Hobart, Tasmania. This first day, I checked into the fabulous Macq Hotel, met up with Harper’s friends Joel & Mustafa, and drank some delicious local gin & whisky. Mustafa and Joel Macq Hotel Hartshorn Sheep Whey gin Potato, onion, & leek frittata, from The Old Wharf in the Macq Hotel Selfie Port Ferry to MONA Macq hotel with cruise ship

item.title: Breakfast before flying to Hobart
item.description: I had a wonderful breakfast at Industry Beans of Tea soaked steel cut oats, chia crumble, caramelised ginger foam, compressed watermelon, rosewater gel and fresh fruit. After, I flew to Hobart, Tasmania for a few days, which was awesome. Breakfast at Industry Beans Espresso at Industry Beans Art Flying to Hobart

item.title: Keith Haring, Street Art, State Library of Victoria, a burger
item.description: I started off the day with a bagel at Mile End Bagels, which was a worthwhile look at what Australian bagels are. This one was good, if not a little off from what I’m used to otherwise. I saw a little art walking around Fitzroy and Collingwood, including a Keith Haring original! I met up with Rob and his family at the Day of the Dead festival at Flagstaff Gardens in the afternoon, before Rob and I headed off onto a walking tour to see all that Melbourne has to offer.

item.title: Grace Cafe, Aunty Peg's, Whisky + Alement, Tonka
item.description: This morning, I had a scrumptious breakfast sandwich (the “Brekkie”) at Grace Cafe near my airbnb. Food and drink continue to amaze me in Melbourne in a way I haven’t seen so consistently well done across an entire city like this before. The eggs were light and fluffy and folded into a perfectly toasted ciabatta, with chives, cheese, sriracha mayo, onion jam. I met up with Taylor at Aunty Peg’s. We enjoyed a coffee cupping before enjoying some coffees at the bar.

item.title: Shandong Mama Mini, NGV, Ian Potter, Eau de Vie, Black Pearl, Capitano
item.description: I had a lunch of “Dill-icious” pork dumplings and garlic cucumber salad with a homemade lemon iced tea at Shandong Mama Mini. I walked down to the National Gallery of Victoria (NGV) International to see the KAWS exhibit, along with a few other things in the permanent collection, before heading to the NGV Ian Potter museum focused on Australian art. After the walking & the sight-seeing, I treated myself to some cocktails at Eau de Vie in the Central Business District and Black Pearl in Fitzroy.

item.title: Lune Croissanteri, Brunswick Street Alimentari, Groceries, & Street art
item.description: I went to Lune Croissanteri for some pastries and coffee this morning, Brunswick Street Alimentari for lunch, and Rock Salt & Vinegar for dinner, before seeing some owl street art on my way home. I also survived my first trip to the grocery store today! Lemon Curd Cruffin from Lune Croissanterie Ham and Gruyere Croissant from Lune Croissanterie The bakers at Lune Croissanterie Porchetta panini from Brunswick Street Alimentari

item.title: Sevens Seeds and Hosier Lane
item.description: I walked down to Carlton and had a delicious open lamb sandwich at Seven Seeds, before continuing my walk to Hosier Lane to see my dope street art. I also met up with Taylor & Maki for dinner! Lamb sandwich at Seven Seeds Mark Zuckerberg is watching you Some shots from Hosier Lane Audrey

item.title: Breakfast at Industry Beans
item.description: My first morning in Melbourne! I walked across the street to Industry Beans, where I had a wonderful breakfast in a beautiful sun-drenched restaurant. Flat white Smoked Manchego Omelette: “Chilli roasted zucchini, pickled sweet fennel, paprika roasted pumpkin seeds and pumpkin sourdough” The interior at Industry Beans

item.title: A walk around Fitzroy
item.description: In order to stave off impending jet lag, I walked around the neighborhood on this beautiful Spring day. Edinburgh Gardens “The Unsung Hero” (2019), by Kathy Holowko Fitzroy Nolij Fitzroy art Baby on top of a building in Fitzroy Fitzroy animal house

item.title: Traveling from Vallejo to Melbourne
item.description: Starting Sunday afternoon California time, I took a Lyft from Vallejo to Sacramento airport, where I endured a 5 hour delay in taking off. We made it to Los Angeles, just in time for me to sprint across two terminals and take a shuttle bus to make it for my next leg from LA to Sydney. Delta’s “Premium Select” was very comfortable with a fairly large TV screen, good food & wine, and quality service from our flight attendants.

item.title: Wine tasting in Sonoma
item.description: Adam, Tara, & I drove from Vallejo up through the greater Sonoma region and Russian River Valley to visit a few wineries: Moshin, VJB, and Domaine Carneros. Later, Adam & I made a brief trip into San Francisco to attend a sound bath, complete with gongs and flutes. The wine was great, while the sound bath was a bit odd (and I probably wouldn’t return any time soon). But we at least got a solid hamburger in at a diner afterwards.

item.title: A lazy day in Vallejo
item.description: A lazy day in Vallejo, California, hanging out with Adam & Peter’s dogs & pig. Chich Uta Ita Backyard

item.title: Leaving NYC
item.description: I checked out from the TWA hotel and took off from NYC, off to California for a few days! Checking out of the TWA hotel Delta airplane to California

item.title: A night at the TWA Hotel
item.description: Before leaving town, I spent the night at the new TWA Hotel at JFK airport, where I enjoyed the Sunken Bar & the Connie bar, which is pretty neat in that it’s inside an actual vintage airplane. A hallway at TWA The Sunken Bar Martini at the Sunken Bar The outside of the Connie bar The airstrip outside the hotel. Inside the Connie bar

item.title: Last day in Brooklyn
item.description: Today, I had lunch at Allswell in Williamsburg, and then walked up to see the Kaws sculpture in Greenpoint, before heading over to Manhattan to pick up some currency ahead of my trip. Allswell, Williamsburg the kaws sculpture

item.title: Union Square Cafe
item.description: Today, I had lunch at one of my favorite spots, Union Square Cafe. Beforehand, I walked past the New York City Columbus Day Parade, and took a few photos. union square cafe a marching band at the parade a float getting ready for the parade

item.title: A day in Manhattan
item.description: Today, I had brunch at Momofuku Ssäm Bar with some friends, walked down to Soho to the REI store to buy a new jacket for my travels, and then I walked home across the Williamsburg Bridge. espresso from saltwater the bar at momofuku ssäm bar ham & bacon cornbread & burrata, with benton’s ham & bacon and pickled chilis, from momofuku ssäm bar brunch at momofuku ssäm bar

item.title: Funemployment: Day Five
item.description: I survived the week! Soundview Royale from the dutch Nori Fries from katana kitten charlie brown in front of the ups warehouse post-haircut selfie Bright and Sunny from katana kitten paul

item.title: Funemployment: Day Four
item.description: times square my aunt, mary davis holt, speaking at nasdaq me

item.title: Funemployment: Day Three
item.description: brisket sandwich from hometown bbq in red hook (brooklyn) clint in front of a wall of flowers in red hook (brooklyn) bottle topper at katana kitten in west village (manhattan) mortadella tonkatsu sando at katana kitten in west village (manhattan)

item.title: Funemployment: Day Two
item.description: the east river from east river state park in williamsburg (brooklyn) espresso at cafe beit in williamsburg (brooklyn) me! nyc transit station

item.title: Funemployment: Day One
item.description: me! men getting on a bus in williamsburg (brooklyn) mist art in domino park in williamsburg (brooklyn) anna art rando art

item.title: New beginnings
item.description: Today, after 5½ year across Modest, PayPal, Braintree, & Venmo, I have turned in my laptop & corporate phone. What’s next? Time to travel! I’ll be keeping this blog updated as I go.

item.title: Hey, y'all
item.description: Welcome to a blog.
